title: Anna Akhmatova
summary: Anna Andreyevna Gorenko[Notes 1] (23 June [O.S. 11 June] 1889 – 5 March 1966), better known by the pen name Anna Akhmatova,[Notes 2] was one of the most significant Russian poets of the 20th century. She was shortlisted for the Nobel Prize in 1965[2] and received second-most (three) nominations for the award the following year.
